column5: we fish the Red lake area -- Little Vermilion and catch a ton of big pike -- the Walleye is also good --
Thank you for all the information. I really appreciate it.
fly-in or drive to? four hours north would nearly get to english river-awesome fishery

Lac Seul, Lost Island Lodge....We are primarily Walleye fisherman but have caught at least one 40"++ Pike on every trip there. Last year the last day my wife caught a 42" and four more over 36" on our last day casting a 1 1/2 oz spinner bait. It was the first time we spent a half day just Pike fishing. I was driving the boat and she was casting. Good Luck, Mike Kansas
Lac Seul, you can not go wrong there.

Lac Seul is one of the finest walleye fisheries in Ontario and also offers decent fishing for northerns. You can choose drive-to or boat-in resorts (american or housekeeping plans), outpost cabins or houseboats. My wife and I have fished LS for the past 13 years and have never been disappointed.

Greetings everyone. My fishing party has fished Eagle, Crow, and LOTW. We are looking for a new fishery within 4 hours of the border. We have fished lakes farther north too, but the goal in 2010, is to not drive more than 4 hours. Are there any lakes or lodges you would recommend? My fishing group fishes more for Northern Pike, however, 2 of the guys like walleyes too. Any ideas, experiences, or recommendations are greatly appreciated. Thanks for taking the time to read this post and thanks in advance for your replies.

I've been to Camp Narrows on the North Arm (the far west end) of Rainy Lake twice. About 15 miles west and 15 miles north of I.F. It's a boat-in, American plan, or cook yourselfGood walleye, northern, and smallmouth fishing. The times we've been there in mid September, there was always a group of 3 or 4 boats that fished exclusively for northerns.Lots of islands and bays so wind is not an issue.Have fun shopping.NimstugSupport The Right To Keep and Arm Bears!
Lac Seul.Everything you are looking for and then some.

What are you and your group looking for in terms of a lodge /resort amenities: What is important (Housekeeping, American Plan, etc) Are you open to a Houseboat? This will help get you get even more suggestions. JDP
Lac Seul is an AWESOME WALLEYE lake.....there are northern too, but LOTS more walleye!

Thanks to everyone for your replies. JDP - to respond to your question, the cabin and lodge isn't important to my group. The quality of the fishing is the most important issue. We are certainly open to doing a house boat.
About 4 hours from the border would put you around the twin cities I'm not sure about fishing in that area
one extra hour drive and you are in the redlake area

Take a look at the Indian Lake Chain. There are 4 lodges available ... Indian Lake Lodge, Clarks Camp/KCs Landing, and Forest Lake Lodge. We have a cabin on Forest. Good walleye, northern and smallmouth, great muskie. 3 hours north of IFalls near Vermilion Bay. I've heard it's better than Eagle.
